page.title: 16Flint Male Voice Choir
page.content: In{1975}a{mixed choir}was formed in Flint, but by{1977}it had become a {Male Voice Choir.}There are 65 middle-aged members today. Mr. John Stone is the{conductor}and Mrs. Hartfree the{accompanist.}The choir wear two different suits, one being a green jacket, black trousers, purple tie and a badge with a picture of the castle, the Dee and the Prince of Wales feathers. One must pass a voice test before joining the choir. They practise in the town hall twice a week, and accept one concert a month. The choir have{performed}in the Albert Hall, Germany and won a{competition}in Butlin's Eisteddfod in 1981. One{sad {occasion}was the death of a 77 year old member who died of a heart attack while returning with the choir from Germany. Flint has an Operatic Society and a Silver Band.
